item.title: Graph Convolution Operator
item.description: For a given graph $\mathcal G$, we have an attribute on each node, denoted as $f_v$. All the node attributes put together can be written as a list $\mathbf f\to (f_{v_1}, f_{v_2}, \cdots, f_{v_N})$. Convolution on graph is combining attributes on nodes with their neighbors'. The adjacency matrix Graph Adjacency Matrix A graph $\mathcal G$ can be represented with an adjacency matrix $\mathbf A$.
